Restauranty 2.0 documentation

views.py

«  urls.py   ::   Contents

views.py¶

Holds information on all of the pages and any functionality those pages need/have.

activeorders(request)¶

Shows orders that have been placed and have not been completed yet.

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.

ReadyToDeliver(request, id)¶

Filters and shows which orders are finished cooking and are ready to be delivered.

Returns:

Does the action upon activeorders.

home(request)¶

Shows the homepage, which is the customer facing part of the app.

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.

menu_item_details(request, item_id)¶

Gives more details on the specific item.

Parameters:

  • request – From Django.

  • item_id – The ID of the item for which more details will be given.

Returns:

Shows the extra information.

tableNumber(request)¶

Sets the table number from user submitted value from post request.

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

The HTTPS response.

SubmitOrder(request)¶

Submit the order when the customer goes through checkout

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

The HTTPS response.

addItem(request, iname, item_id)¶

Adds an item to the basket (varying quantity).

Parameters:

  • request – From Django.

  • iname – The item name.

  • item_id – The item ID.

Returns:

The HTTPS response.

waiter(request)¶

Render the waiter page, waiter can see orders and their status.

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.

about(request)¶

Render the about us page

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.

checkout(request)¶

Renders the checkout, showing the items in the basket

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.

Delivered(request, id)¶

Deletes an order from the order table since the order has been delivered.

Parameters:

  • request – From Django.

  • id – The ID of the order that’s been delivered.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.

Cancelled(request)¶

Deletes an order since it’s been cancelled by the customer

Parameters:

request – From Django.

Returns:

Renders the actual page from the html template.
